intro: Onosma aksoyii, commonly known as the Turkish thyme, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinct appearance. Onosma aksoyii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
